verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. A Psalm of David. Answer <WH6030> me when I call <WH7121>, O God <WH430> of my righteousness <WH6664>; Thou hast set me at large <WH7337> when I was in distress <WH6862>: Have mercy <WH2603> upon me <WH8085>, and hear my prayer <WH8605>.

O ye sons <WH1121> of men <WH376>, how long <WH5704> shall my glory <WH3519> be turned into dishonor <WH3639>? How long will ye love <WH157> vanity <WH7385>, and seek <WH1245> after falsehood <WH3577>? [Selah <WH5542>]
But know <WH3045> that Jehovah <WH3068> hath set apart <WH6395> for himself him that is godly <WH2623>: Jehovah <WH3068> will hear <WH8085> when I call unto him <WH7121>.
Stand in awe <WH7264>, and sin <WH2398> not <WH559>: Commune with your own heart <WH3824> upon your bed <WH4904>, and be still <WH1826>. [Selah <WH5542>]
Offer <WH2076> the sacrifices <WH2077> of righteousness <WH6664>, And put your trust <WH982> in Jehovah <WH3068>.
Many <WH7227> there are that say <WH559>, Who will show <WH7200> us any good <WH2896>? Jehovah <WH3068>, lift thou up <WH5375> the light <WH216> of thy countenance upon us <WH6440>.
Thou hast put <WH5414> gladness <WH8057> in my heart <WH3820>, More than they have when <WH6256> their grain <WH1715> and their new wine <WH8492> are increased <WH7231>.
In peace <WH7965> will I both <WH3162> lay me down <WH7901> and sleep <WH3462>; For thou <WH3068>, Jehovah, alone <WH910> makest me dwell <WH3427> in safety <WH983>.
